title: Title: Public preferences for interventions to prevent emerging infectious disease threats: a discrete choice experiment -supplementary material Authors (family names underlined)
body: : Utility estimates under main model, all participants. 95% CrI is the 95% equal-tailed credible interval. The utility for all unlisted levels are set to 0. For the all-participant, the utility for 180 deaths is anchored to − . For mortality-averse and expenditure-averse results, 95% CI is the 95% equal-tailed confidence interval for the posterior mean utility.
